Technique: FORMED BY HAND; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL
Name: Jar
Description: Piriform pottery vessel with rounded base, wide outward flaring mouth and pronounced rim. The upper half of the outer surface is decorated with a white slip, irregularly applied. This jar was placed, presumably with offerings, in a tomb of the early Middle Kingdom at Abydos. Several other pots in this collection are marked as coming from the same tomb, indicating a burial of some wealth.
